summary:
I am a results-driven architect and leader, driving towards results in all types of environments.  I'm currently the infrastructure architect at Triodos Bank in the Netherlands, where my focus is driving a vision of agility, stability, high performance, and sustainability for Triodos customers.

I have 5 years of leading/managing a high-performing global engineering team and 7 years of experience managing projects ensuring they align with business requirements, follow standards, and are cost-efficient.  I’ve been a key player in transforming methodologies from legacy on-premise waterfall-style infrastructure development to more agile, cloud-first, CI-focused successes.  I have extensive experience getting the most out of vendors across the globe, whether in Europe, the Americas, or Asia.

My technical experience is broad, with Systems & Network design at my core.  For over 13 years, I’ve been responsible for designing and implementing a wide range of technologies to ensure they meet the needs of our customers.  Whether designing a high-latency comms network for Special Forces in Afghanistan or creating highly available solutions for a multinational enterprise-level company, I have the experience to drive towards the best solution that adds the most value for the client and company.  

Finally, I’ve lived and worked in four different countries over the past 10 years bringing a unique mix of cultural awareness, technical expertise, and leadership skills.  

I am currently based in Utrecht, Netherlands, originally from Canada.

awards: [{'title': 'General Service Medal - SOUTH-WEST ASIA', 'description': 'The GSM with SOUTH-WEST ASIA ribbon is awarded to Canadian citizens other than members of the Canadian Forces who served in direct support of the Canadian participation to the International Security Assistance Force (ISAF) in Afghanistan while deployed inside the theatre of operations consisting of the political boundaries of Afghanistan and its airspace for at least 30 cumulative days between April 24, 2003 and July 31, 2009; (http://www.cmp-cpm.forces.gc.ca/dhr-ddhr/chc-tdh/chart-tableau-eng.asp?ref=GSM)', 'issuer': 'Canadian Forces', 'date': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, {'title': 'Exemplary Service Award - OP MOBILE', 'description': 'This award was given for making a significant contribution in support of the Canadian Forces during Operation Mobile (http://www.cjoc.forces.gc.ca/exp/mobile/index-eng.asp)', 'issuer': 'Department of National Defence', 'date': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, {'title': 'Exemplary Service Award - OP ATHENA', 'description': 'This award was given for making a significant contribution in support of the Canadian Forces in Afghanistan during Operation Athena  (http://www.cjoc.forces.gc.ca/exp/athena/index-eng.asp)', 'issuer': 'Department of National Defence', 'date': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}]

projects: [{'title': 'National Defence Afghanistan Project (OP ATHENA)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'description': 'In 2010, I was involved in a Network renewal and enhancements project in Kandahar, Afghanistan for Operation ATHENA for the Department of National Defence.  The goal of the project was to renew existing network infrastructure and implement new sub-sites throughout the base.  These implementations and enhancements involved both static and mobile sites.  This project proved to be challenging not only technically but also mentally and physically due to the long hours (~10-12 hour days, 7 days per week over 1.5 months) and unique location.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ryan', 'last_name': 'Jones', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Infra Architect at Triodos'}]}]
